refnamediv.refpurpose: Archive object files into a static library

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Archive object files into an &ar; archive, also known as a statically linked library. See &so.7mk; to produce a dynamically linked library.
For sake of convenient linking, archives are expected to be named beginning with “lib”, in the form libname.a, such that they may be resolved by the linker as -lname.

It is recommended to collate object files into one partially-linked object file by way of &part.7mk;, and then to archive that single file. This avoids passing possibly conflicting file names to &ar; without relying on full path names, which not all implementations support.

refsection.title: Input
refsection.synopsis:
AR ?= ar RANLIB ?= ar s ARFLAGS ?= cr
BUILD = dir LIB += libname
${BUILD}/lib/libname.o:
